Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery column-krater: interior glazed black with (accidental?) incised band at centre of sherd; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of Athena and warrior in chariot to right (of Athena, helmeted head with flesh in added white, upper torso, holding round shield decorated with red dots and other white decoration on her left arm, and raised right arm holding a spear; of warrior, part of red bearded and helmeted face and holding a Boeotian shield with red rim and a spear remaining; at right, part of horse's red mane); also visible on sherd are part of a goad and reins.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 40, pl. XX, no. 33)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 284, no. B251)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0973)
